business_terms.definition: A business entity that purchases products from Adventure Works and resells them to end customers
Direct sales to customers through the Adventure Works online store
The total monetary value of a sale before any discounts are applied. Calculated as Unit Price × Order Quantity
The line item total after applying unit price discounts. Formula: Unit Price × Order Quantity × (1 - Unit Price Discount Pct)
The cost to Adventure Works for products sold. Used to calculate profit margins
Revenue minus cost of goods sold. Calculated as Sales Amount - Total Product Cost
Gross profit expressed as a percentage of sales. Formula: (Sales Amount - Total Product Cost) / Sales Amount × 100
The number of units of a product ordered in a single transaction
Adventure Works fiscal year runs from July 1st to June 30th. FY 2013 means July 1, 2012 to June 30, 2013
Q1: Jul-Sep, Q2: Oct-Dec, Q3: Jan-Mar, Q4: Apr-Jun
Standard calendar year from January 1st to December 31st
Geographic region assigned to a sales representative or team. Examples: Northwest, Southwest, Northeast, Southeast, Canada, France, Germany, Australia
Higher-level grouping of territories. Values: North America, Europe, Pacific
Top-level product classification. Categories: Bikes, Components, Clothing, Accessories
Detailed product classification within categories. Examples: Mountain Bikes, Road Bikes, Helmets, Jerseys, etc.
The baseline manufacturing or acquisition cost for a product
The manufacturer's suggested retail price (MSRP) for a product
The wholesale price offered to resellers, typically lower than list price
Product quality tier. Values: R (Road), M (Mountain), T (Touring), S (Standard)
Individual consumer or business/organization customer
A customer who has made at least one purchase in the last 12 months
Total revenue generated from a customer across all their purchases
Classification of reseller business. Types: Warehouse, Value Added Reseller, Specialty Bike Shop
Target sales amount assigned to a salesperson for a specific time period (usually quarterly)
Percentage of quota met. Formula: (Actual Sales / Sales Quota) × 100
Percentage change in a metric compared to the same period in the previous year. Formula: ((Current Year - Previous Year) / Previous Year) × 100
Percentage change in a metric compared to the previous month
Average sales amount per transaction. Formula: Total Sales Amount / Number of Orders
Total number of product units sold across all transactions
Specific design or version of a product. Example: 'Mountain-100' is a model within Mountain Bikes subcategory
Customer's stated reason for purchase. Examples: Price, Quality, Manufacturer, Review, Television Advertisement
Marketing campaign or discount offer. Examples: 'Mountain-100 Clearance Sale', 'Touring-3000 Promotion'
Percentage reduction from list price offered to customer
Sales tax collected on the transaction based on ship-to location tax rates
Shipping and handling charges for order delivery
Monetary unit for the transaction. Adventure Works operates in USD, CAD, EUR, GBP, AUD
Conversion rate between foreign currency and USD for international sales
Unique identifier for each sales transaction. Format: SO######
Adventure Works staff member. Relevant for tracking sales performance by salesperson
Organizational unit within Adventure Works. Examples: Sales, Marketing, Production, Quality Assurance
Customer or employee gender. Values: M (Male), F (Female)
Customer marital status. Values: M (Married), S (Single)
Customer education attainment. Values: High School, Partial College, Bachelors, Graduate Degree
Customer's profession. Examples: Professional, Management, Skilled Manual, Clerical
Indicates if customer owns their home. Values: Yes/No
Number of vehicles owned by customer, used for customer segmentation
Customer's distance from work. Categories: 0-1 Miles, 1-2 Miles, 2-5 Miles, 5-10 Miles, 10+ Miles
Customer's annual income, used for customer segmentation and targeting
Number of children in customer's household
Expected payment due date for reseller orders
Date when order was shipped to customer
Number of days between order date and ship date

The fact table containing all direct online sales. Table name: factinternetsales. Contains columns: productkey, orderdatekey, duedatekey, shipdatekey, customerkey, promotionkey, currencykey, salesterritorykey, salesordernumber, salesorderlinenumber, orderquantity, unitprice, extendedamount, totalproductcost, salesamount, taxamt, freight, orderdate, duedate, shipdate. Use this for all 'internet sales' or 'online sales' queries.

business_rules.description: Always use SalesAmount (not ExtendedAmount) for revenue reporting unless specifically analyzing discounts
Profit = SalesAmount - TotalProductCost. Do not subtract freight or tax from profit calculations
When calculating sales metrics, exclude records where SalesAmount is NULL or 0
All financial reporting should be in USD. Use exchange rate tables for converting foreign currency sales
Default to Fiscal Year for financial reporting unless specifically asked for Calendar Year
Each sale must be assigned to a sales territory. Use geography-based assignment for internet sales and reseller location for reseller sales

Internet sales come from factinternetsales table (direct customers). Reseller sales come from factresellersales table (business partners). When user mentions 'internet', 'online', 'direct', or 'customer sales', use factinternetsales. When they mention 'reseller', 'partner', or 'wholesale', use factresellersales.
